name: IAM Environments
title: IAM Environments
body:
Overview

In managing software environments, particularly for EFS and Okta integrations, it’s crucial to maintain clear distinctions between development, testing, and production environments. This guide provides details on the various environments used within the system, their purposes, access links, and best practices for usage to ensure stability and security.

POC

Purpose: Test and Develop

Link to Admin Access: https://questback-poc-admin.oktapreview.com/admin/dashboard

General Link to login: oktapoc.customervoice360.com

Mapping environment: DevQA/dev-us-01 and any other testing and development environment

Rules of the House:

This is a test and development account. Everything could be broken or wiped at any point in time. Take care not to go for assumptions.

 

Production (Tivian)

Purpose: Server our clients needs

Link to Admin Access: https://tivian-admin.okta.com/admin/dashboard

General Link to login: access.tivian.com

Mapping environment: all production environments, all sandbox environments

Rules of the House:

This is production! Don’t break anything. Rethink if you really need access to this environment.
